title: Weight Loss
Caloric: Create a calorie deficit of 500-750 calories per day to lose about 1-1.5 pounds per week
Distribution: Aim for a balance of macronutrients, such as 40% carbohydrates, 30% protein, and 30% fats

Sample.Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, vegetables, and vinaigrette dressing.
Sample.Dinner: Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed vegetables.

title: Muscle Gain
Caloric: Caloric Surplus: Consume a calorie surplus of 250-500 calories per day to support muscle growth.
Distribution: Increase protein intake to about 25-30% of total calories, along with adequate carbohydrates and healthy fats.

Sample.Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with whole-grain toast and avocado.
Sample.Snack: Protein shake with banana and almond butter.
Sample.Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with brown rice and roasted vegetables.
Sample.Dinner: Lean beef stir-fry with quinoa and broccoli.

title: Athletic Performance
Distribution: Maintain a balance of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats to support energy levels and muscle recovery.

Sample.Breakfast: Whole-grain cereal with milk and sliced fruit.
Sample.Lunch: Turkey and avocado wrap with whole-grain tortilla and side salad.
Sample.Snack2: Protein smoothie with whey protein, spinach, and berries.
Sample.Dinner: Grilled fish with sweet potato and steamed vegetables
